name: notcool
text: That's good enough for me.

text: He screamed, as his eyes flew from his head.

name: landowmpg
text: Chubbied for old school Sesame Street.

name: mercuri0us
text: Most of them are q's.

name: overmedicated
text: Also Peach, which appears to be Phillipe's (also P) natural fur colour. that or Magnolia, I suppose.

name: joeyramoney
text: which is perfectly natural for an otter.

name: biddlebubbly
text: Philippe's mouth is probably not the best for eating with.

name: perhapsmaybe
text: this one does pretty well in color

name: planetidiot
text: it makes sense if you are five

name: nexus
text: A comment left by nexus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by pwb, Jesler729, Deusoma, Audhumla, saucy_jack, DeathwishJones)

name: jdhenry105
text: Those porkchops are hell of rare.

name: mnemon
text: Raw even.  I question Teodore's ability to actually cook.

name: echidnaboy
text:
In the last two frames it looks like Philippe is eating Turkish Delight.

Meat should not resemble Turkish Delight.

name: carpetbag
text: Is eating pork chops with applesauce a common sort of thing? I ask this because I once heard someone say "pork chops and applesauce" and as a Jew-type person I am unfamiliar with what constitutes a proper pork chop condiment.

name: alejandroadam
text: we ate it many times in my youth. I am mainly from the serria nevada desert regions. (Mojave, and Reno) it is good white-trash food, it would make Elvis proud

name: jamers
text: I admit to dipping a pchop in applesauce many a time. Delicious.

name: stoned_lightning
text: I'm from England and that's just what you have with pork of any kind.

name: jhunter
text: i'm from england and i just threw up a little in my mouth

name: i_love_kate
text:
It's very traditional, stemming from the ancient idea that foods had certain "humours" that needed to be kept in balance for the sake of the health.

In our modern age of enlightenment, however, we can acknowledge that just because people have been eating foods a certain way for centuries doesn't mean that it doesn't taste terrible.

name: stuart
text: It read it as a Kraftwerk Thanksgiving-esque "I ate it many times in my mouth".

name: spectre
text: Applesauce is the standard German accompaniment to pork chops and also the standard here in the US, especially in the Northeast and Midwest. Homer Simpson's favorite dinner is pork chops and applesauce.

name: tellumo
text: Applesauce is also a thing with lamb chops.

name: overmedicated
text: Dogg you trippin', mint sauce all the way.

name: tellumo
text: I've never had mint sauce with lamb chops, but I should try it next time I get a chance. I understand that's more of a British thing, which I'll admit gives me pause, but I'll try just about anything once.

name: fineoakstructure
text: It is so unnecessary.  Last time I had lamb chops I kept giving the mint sauce a chance, but I ain't know why.  It was a slightly fancier sauce though, I can't remember exactly, like mint-lemon or something like that.  It was largely nonsense, that's for sure.

name: farqussus
text: MINT WITH LAMB, YOU FOOL!

name: jollysaintpete
text: yogurt-cucumber whitesauce with lamb. is this the same thing? i know there is traditionally some mint in the whitesauce, but i have never had lamb with just a 'mint sauce'

name: farqussus
text: you're thinking of tzatziki i think. Mint sauce is just crushed leaves in vinegar.

name: hifihero
text: Having sampled the options, I gotta go with the tzatziki. Achewood always makes me want Greek food.

name: belgand
text: Or mint jelly.

name: tekende
text: Why would you need any kind of sauce? If the lamb is made well, it should be absolutely delicious all on its own.

name: aelindil
text: THANK YOU.

name: tekende
text: YOU'RE WELCOME.

name: yaotzin
text: Typically when cooking pork bright acidic flavors are welcome. Accents like; Mustard, Lemon, White Wine (Reisling is good), spiced brines, and sometimes even savory fruit compotes will find their way in a pork dish. Applesauce would certainly fit that criteria. However I would probably be more likely to make a brine with apple cider than plate apple sauce, and instead plate with a tangy mustard sauce instead.

name: origotoshi
text:
O.O

That was... amazingly knowledgeable.

name: dybrar
text: yaotzin has mad pork chops.

name: yaotzin
text:
punny

A chubby for you sir.

It is six months later apparently and I find myself with two jars of applesauce in my ice box. I am contemplating some sort of filled pastry, details may be forthcoming.

name: ssddr
text: I still am not fond of when foods on my plate intermingle and marry.

name: totoro23
text: A comment left by totoro23 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, jamb23, Thorfinn, shutup_shutup, decagon, equinn2006, shoinan, killerlimpet, SPECTRE)

name: carpetbag
text: There is a profound difference between downs syndrome and autism, the disability had by the narrator in the book you reference.

name: peterjoel
text: Who mentioned Downs Syndrome??!

name: bixschmix
text:
In correcting totoro for equating retardation and autism, carpetbag equated retardation and Down's Syndrome.

**THIS CONCLUDES EXPLANATION THEATRE**

name: shutup_shutup
text: All of this has resulted in me thinking up the word "autarded."  And that's terrible.

name: spectre
text: He was AUTISTIC, no retarded. He did calculus. Can you do calculus? Supply proof.

name: killerlimpet
text:
and provided a swell recap of the Monty Hall problem.

Man that thing kicked me in the balls when my discrete teacher showed it to us

name: woodenteeth
text: I think we can all agree that after about 2 chapters of that book we all put it down and became very dissapointed with the taste of whoever recommended it.

name: kelsotimebomb
text: Oh, pwnd.  I actually liked that book.

name: foetus_punch
text: I like to think that we bonded over some terrible insults, but that is an alright book. I'm sorry to betray you in this way.

name: woodenteeth
text: No. Differing opinions are not lame worthy. Even if half of this Assetworld would believe otherwise. The premise of the book was great, but I had no sympathy for the main character, I found his "voice" started sounding too much like a normal person trying to sound like someone with a mental handicap.

name: aelindil
text:
The author was drawing on his experiences working with autistic people, but I imagine it is difficult to really write in that voice.

That said, I liked the book and am sorry you did not.

name: deancain29
text: vivid

name: closefriend
text: Color... strips... so... incongruous... AARGH!

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "Pork chops and applesauce voted unpopular in Phillipe's Mind."

name: yourgoodtwin
text: I just have to say that this was my favorite strip for a long time.  Anytime we peer into Phillipe's mind is a joy.  This is at the top of that joy.

name: greymantledwolf
text: we've all been there... at first.

name: mrblank91
text: No Phillipe, you'll get tapeworm!

name: plummet
text:
Holy friggin' shit.

COLOUR!!!!!!

name: joeyramoney
text: those are some red-ass pork chops.

name: nicolae
text: Phillipe's screaming too but he can't stop rockin' with the chops 'n sauce.

name: aurorasbored
text: Pork with applesauce makes a heckuva lot more sense than mint with lamb. *shudder* Not...of...God.

name: tbtabby
text: I'm still trying to get over chocolate-covered pretzels. How can they taste so good?

name: rowboat
text: How couldn't they?

name: lux
text: Yogurt-covered is where it's at.

name: vreeeee
text: Nooo!

name: nucleargeranium
text: I can certainly tell the two foodstuff's universal distastes of each other by the screaming they are doing when they confront each other.

name: lux
text: Good job! You comprehended the strip!

name: blarghamagarky
text: Teodor is the color of applesauce

name: echidnaboy
text: That is not an appetising meal

name: re5urgam
text: appletising

name: vice
text: Oddly enough, the color strips are some of the worst looking in my opinion, but also some of the funniest.

name: trumbot
text:
I stand by Phillipe in this.
Being sad over throwing away nasty, stained couches? Not so much.

name: mattylite
text: Wish there were a five and a half, maybe with Beef's eyes all turning into vertical slits like when he freaks out, because this one, for me, was The One for so long.  Maybe it still is.

name: jawsh
text: I imagine pork chops and the apple sauce have tiny mouse-like sped up voices

name: clever-nickname
text:
i just had porkchops with applesauce.

all i could think was "nooo!"

name: hairymoonstone
text: Phillipe's mouth disgusts me. Good day sirs.

name: hamscout
text:
Reminds me of soon-to-be Lisa Simpson sitting at the dinner table, imagining the food falling from a living being onto her plate,
[IMGS OFF]
(including the hot dog made of rat tail, raccoon feet, pigeon head, and boot tongue)!

name: cyberia
text: For some reason, seeing Philippe with apricot-coloured fur makes me uncomfortable

name: farqussus
text: he looks freshly shaven. that's bad.

name: mrfedora
text: nooooooooo!

name: kikineko
text: Sweet coloured Philippe!  I love how he imagines that his food can talk.  Now if we can make food that fun.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
Philippe, your imagination is wrong.

this is delicious.

name: thebigmike1983
text: I must diagree with this assessment of pork chops and applesauce.

name: thebigmike1983
text: Ugh, I shame myself with my spelling.

name: aperson
text: Apple sauce and pork chop didn't want it to end this way.

text: i wonder if this has anything to do with philippe using the word applesauce as an expletive...
